page.title: 07Religious life
page.content: Both Widmerpool and Wysall have parish churches, Wysall's C13 with spire, Wid -merpool's with C15 tower (no spire, it was struck by lightning in 1836). The villages share a parson with nearby Willoughby; Wysall has about 70 & Widmerpool 42 on the Electoral Roll. Both churches have a Sunday School, a {Mother's Union}covers the 3 parishes, so does Pathfinders (11-14 yr). Wysall has a wives fellowship and a group of musicians, Widmerpool a choir. There is a lay training group for{MU}ladies, and prayer groups are held in the vil- lages. Services are held 3 times a month in Wysall, 2 or 3 times in Wid- merpool; the congregations unite for some special services. The Methodist chapel in Wysall is well supported. Relations between the denominations are good - some joint coffee mornings and Methodist members of{MU.}
